Detailed Description

An Application is the central instance for handling and routing messages. All incoming messages are treated in OnMessage and routed to user-dispatchers and windows. Every application is part of an application-container and can have one or more windows. To extend the handling and routing of messages in an easy manner it is possible to add user-defined dispatchers to an application.

void Application::GrabFocus (  BOOLEAN  assign_to_win  ) 
 

Obsolete - the parameter assign_to_win is ignored. Use Application::GrabFocus() instead.

BOOLEAN Application::GrabFocus (   ) 
 

Tries to grab the focus for the application.

Returns:
TRUE is returned, if the application will get the focus. Note that the focus will be assigned asynchronously and is not assigned immediatly after invoking Application::GrabFocus. See also Application::OnGetFocus for details. FALSE is returned, if an application with a higher focus-priority has the focus.

BOOLEAN Application::HandleMsg (  const MessageReferrer &  msg_ref  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Handles the message which the message referrer msg_ref points to.

Implements ExecutionContext.

BOOLEAN Application::HasFocus (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE if the application currently has the focus. Only one application can have the focus. Note that TRUE does not necessarily mean that Application::OnGetFocus has already been invoked, as the message routing is done asynchronously. But it is assured that if an application is marked as focused the method Application::OnGetFocus will be invoked later.

BOOLEAN Application::IsRunning (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the application is attached to an application_container and is up running.

BOOLEAN Application::OnMessage (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Every message send to an application may be dispatched in OnMessage.

See also:
Dispatcher::OnMessage

Implements Dispatcher.

Reimplemented in AtlApplication, and GltpConnApp.

void Application::OnOpen (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called after the default initialization process.

Reimplemented in AtlApplication, and GltpConnApp.

BOOLEAN Application::OnShutdownRequest (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked when the system wants to shutdown, but the application wants to block the shutdown (see SetShutdownAllowed() and IsShutdownAllowed for details). The standard implementation of that method returns FALSE to prevent a shutting down. This method maybe overwritten to e. g. open a modal window to ask "Do you really want to shutdown?".

Returns:
TRUE continues the shutdown, FALSE blocks the shutdown.

void Application::OnStartup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called after attaching the application to an AppContainer for pre-start initialization.

Reimplemented in AtlApplication, and GltpConnApp.

Is called, if the theme has been changed.

BOOLEAN Application::OnTimeout (  const Timer &  timer  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if a timer expires.

BOOLEAN Application::OnVeryLongKeyPress (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if a key has been pressed and the duration exceeded the very-long-key-press limit. The code of the key is given by key_code.

void Application::Post (  const Message &  msg  )  const
 

Posts the message msg asynchronous to the message-router-queue, which will broadcast the message to all applications, which have subscribed for this message.

void Application::RegisterMessage (  MsgId  msg_id  )  [virtual]
 

Registers a message to the ExecutionContext. Only registered messages are accepted and handled.

Implements ExecutionContext.

void Application::RemoveTimer (  Timer &  timer  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Removes the timer from the context.

Implements ExecutionContext.

void Application::RemoveWindow (  Window *  win  ) 
 

Removes a window from the application. It should not be necessary to invoke this method, as it is invoked automatically when closing a window.

BOOLEAN Application::RouteMessage (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Routing messages on application level is working the following way:

  • First of all Application::OnMessage is called.
  • Afterwards the message is routed to all attached UserDispatchers.
  • Messages of class MC_FOCUS are routed to the focused Window.
  • Messages of class MC_CONTROL are routed to the specific Control.
  • All other messages are routed to all Windows of the Application.
  • At the end the base class Application itself handles the message and triggers the calls of the OnX methods (e.g. KeyDownMsg -> OnKeyDown). This sequence will be interrupted immediately if any of the involved methods is returning TRUE.

Reimplemented from Dispatcher.

Reimplemented in AtlApplication.
